values: If you'd like to be added, comment to this post. If I know you online, in person, or elsewhere(?!), you'll be welcome aboard!

day 29 - a song from your childhood Baby Baluga by Raffi. I remember my dad singing this to me all the time when I was little. Or maybe he played the tape. Or both. We had/have a Raffi music book and I remember opening it up and trying to sing the songs or play them on my cheap, tiny, battery-powered, whiny piano. I think it was a Christmas book. I remember a page's illustration. http://youtu.be/EZGwWslUyA4 day 28 - a song that makes you feel guilty How should I know? I'd rather not knowingly remember a song like that. RAFFI CHRISTMAS. Oh, indoctrination of Santa Claus. Listen for the tone-deaf child. Poor Raffi. http://youtu.be/63VIU9oWtHY
day 26 - a song that you can play on an instrument Clementi Sonatinas. I'm currently learning #2. http://youtu.be/S2Sejv2_uLU
day 25 - a song that makes you laugh Being for the Benefit of Mr. Kite by the Beatles, performed by Eddie Izzard. Especially that miniature dry hump. Song begins at 0:40 http://youtu.be/59ahx9ckqIw
day 19 - a song from your favorite album Journey To the Past from Anastasia. All you emotive singers from Glee can eat it. Liz Callaway was here first, mm-hm. #biased http://youtu.be/7bCKBHvpNSg
day 18 - a song that you wish you heard on the radio How about everything by Lenka or The Hush Sound? <3 http://youtu.be/DW8rg6XeP3U http://youtu.be/SdOTun8TWlc

day 16 - a song that you used to love but now hate Betrayed from The Producers. I love it, but heard it too much. I'll gladly watch it with the whole musical, though. Gosh, I want to see that again. I'm not posting it for the people who haven't seen it. If you haven't seen the play leading up to this song, it sounds pretty schizo. Inside jokes abound.
day 15 - a song that describes you Like a Child by Jars of Clay: Favorite songs tend to follow you. http://youtu.be/Hfix3Weushg

day 14 - a song that no one would expect you to love Pretty much any heavy metal. Here's a random: Raining Blood by Slayer http://youtu.be/CUDWLp1yIWw And Rob Zombie songs are pretty catchy, but this video is just plain hilarious: Dragula http://youtu.be/EqQuihD0hoI

day 13 - a song that is a guilty pleasure Very likely this one. Sweet Transvestite from Rocky Horror. It's just... Tim Curry in drag. http://youtu.be/bc80tFJpTuo Straight from the movie! I can't bear to watch any other. And the way he stomps his foot in that cape.
day 12 - a song from a band you hate ...I can't think of any!

day 11 - a song from your favorite band The Flood by Jars of Clay. Nostalgia time! I actually LOVE all their songs, so this one's a random. This was probably the first song of theirs I ever heard. http://youtu.be/wNGLU_VsePg A newer fav. A prayer. Not the official video. http://youtu.be/txqeyisb688

day 10 - a song that makes you fall asleep Conan's lullaby for babies. This clip is the only one I can find. It begins in the middle. The gist is that parents are up late watching tv because they're trying to get their babies to fall asleep. (Conan was a young dad at this point, too!) Once in a while, he'd whip out his guitar to help the parents lull the baby to sleep. It begins with something like "Little baby, to go sleep... your comprehension's awfully low, so it doesn't matter what I say..." He lists a lot of things from the news that give people anxiety. Then, he asks parents to turn the baby away so he can continue to entertain the non-parent viewers. The song continues while the tv shows disturbing images. ^_^ When I was sick or cranky, singing this song to myself helped me get to sleep. http://youtu.be/_eKFLvrWXPM Action/Adventure by Andrew Bird. IDK, this is just a great song. Looping likely has a calming affect on me. http://youtu.be/o-XQcGVVp_c

day 08 - a song that you know all the words to The Oogie Boogie Song from The Nightmare Before Christmas! I need to see this movie again. ^_^ I love Ken Page http://youtu.be/6CSk1H1CNME and Baby One More Time by Britney Spears. I will sing along on demand. Oh, shut up. http://youtu.be/C-u5WLJ9Yk4
day 07 - a song that reminds you of a certain event Ave Maria. High school betrayal rendered pointless by time. http://youtu.be/KSQFc4SsdR0

day 06 - a song that reminds you of somewhere The Tide by the Newsboys: I used to listen to this every Christmas on the road from Dayton to back home. It's a great sleepytime car song. http://youtu.be/6vZvdyqVaDY

day 05 - a song that reminds you of someone Schulmaedchen Report by Gert Wilden and Orchestra: This reminds me of my high school German teacher, for some reason. It seems like something he'd watch, music he'd like. http://youtu.be/8lMDojY3YP0
day 04 - a song that makes you sad Viva Forever by the Spice Girls: Say what you want about the trippy video and any misreadings I may have, but I believe this is about leaving childhood.

day 03 - a song that makes you happy If any part of this song doesn't make you smile--lyrically, musically, comedically--go see a doctor to get your funny bone checked. (sorry if there's an ad before)
day 02 - your least favorite song No! If I told you, then you'd torture me with it and get it stuck in my head! =P

Spiderman! Because he had broody soliloquies.

Also, Batman, because he's quite dark.

Other tops:
Rogue
Gambit
Wovlerine


I'm not sure if these are heroes. Depends on the episode, I guess:
Catwoman
Harlequinn

Definitely open to personal modifications. I'd like to try it with ham sometime. Serves: 4-5 people Ingredients: 12-16 oz pasta (any shape) 8-10 oz frozen broccoli (optional) 1 tsp salt 1/4 cup butter (or margarine, or smart balance) 3 cups milk 4 cheeses (I use two slices each of Mozzarella, Muenster, Provolone, and shredded Parmesan) * spices recommended: salt onion powder (or onion pieces) black pepper red pepper (or paprika) bread crumbs (optional) Directions: In large pot, boil pasta and frozen broccoli. Add salt and cook to al dente. Drain pasta in sink. Leave colander in sink, return pot to stove and melt butter in 2 cups milk over low heat. When melted, add pasta into the pot. Tear the mozzarella, muenster, and provolone in to shreds, add gradually into the pot while stirring. Add remaining 1 cup milk when mixture becomes harder to stir. Stir in spices to taste. Onion powder and black pepper are highly recommended. Serving option 1: Serve onto plate, sprinkle parmesan on top. Serving option 2: (canola or vegetable oil needed for greasing) Preheat oven to 200 degrees. In large, greased glass pan, pour in half the macaroni mixture (the more you have, the larger the pan should be). Sprinkle over parmesan and bread crumbs. Pour over the remaining macaroni mixture, sprinkle over parmesan and bread crumbs. Bake at 200 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve and enjoy! *see comments

Starting the day with Gatorade AND coffee was such a good idea 30 minutes ago! My energy was finally renewed, and now that it's out of my system, I have to lie down.

*finger shoots from the floor to the sky* However! I shall remember the morning concoction tomorrow.

Na No Wri Mo: 29 days

Conan: 36 days






...ATION!

Chronological order. Right shoe, left shoe.

1. Pinchy and Stabby - Bloch, Signature Rehearsal
2. Oxford and Mulligan - Bloch, Signature Rehearsal
3. Emily Howard and Florence (from Little Britain) - Bloch, Synergy
4. Karone and Astronema (from Power Rangers In Space) - Freed, ??
5. Conando and Andino (Conan's fake Hispanic name, my name for Andy) - Russian Pointe, Sapfir?
6. Aaron and Bley (named after Aaron Bleyaert) - Russian Pointe, Sapfir

Day 28 - First book or series obsession The Laura Ingalls Wilder books. I still haven't read all of them, but they mean something because my mom and I shared them. One of these days, I'll read them all. Day 29 - Saddest character death OR best/most satisfying character death How about the funniest? Vizzini.
Day 27 - If a book contains _____, you will always read it! Eighteenth century aristocrats. Especially funny and smart ones. I'm always looking for the next Scarlet Pimpernel.

Day 22 - What is your policy on book lending? I have to read it first. It seems cruel to lend a book and send it out into the world (albeit briefly) when I don't know what it contains. Besides, I'm a hoarder. It's mine until I'm done with it.

Day 21 - What will inspire you to recommend a book? If I love it, I'll share it. But only if I love it. I'm not likely to mention a book I'm "meh" about. Why spread mediocrity? I do share books I hate, though, when on literary rants.

Day 19 - Favorite book cover (bonus points for posting an image!) Can't find the name of a book I read a long time ago that had a cool cover, so here's City of Ember instead. Simple. I haven't read it, but this cover makes me want to. Many novel covers should be full of this mystery. Day 20 - Favorite kiss Don't have access to the book right now, so here's a quote from the movie: "Since the invention of the kiss, there have been five kisses that were rated the most passionate, the most pure. This one left them all behind." (The Princess Bride)

Day 17 - Favorite story or collection of stories IDK! How about a collection of one liners, like Shit, My Dad Says? Haven't read it, but every one I have read was good. That so counts. Day 18 - Favorite beginning scene in a book Sandoz drunk. Honestly, a tipsy Jesuit can't get any cuter. ^_^ Technically not the first scene in the book, but it is first chronologically. (The Sparrow, Mary Doria Russell) Also: Two friends, who are pretending not to be friends, fight about a hat in public. (Gentlemen of the Road, Michael Chabon)
Day 16 - Favorite poem or collection of poetry Love me some John Keats.
Day 15 - Your "comfort" book Ferguson's BTBATR and The Bible.
Day 14 - Favorite character in a book HOLY CRAP I DON'T KNOW. Um... Um... JESUS! MOSES. PAUL. MY PAULIEEEEEEEEEEEE! I really don't know. Would list all my characters, but they probably don't count.

Day 12 - What books do you have on request at the library? The Late Shift by Bill Carter, about the Leno/Letterman shit. (Coincidentally, I always read the title as The Late Shit.) I cannot hope for a Late Shift 2 until I have read the first and seen the journalistic/historic bias made. Day 13 - Bad book habit? I get too many without knowing what they're even about. Fill-a-bag sales and thrift stores beware! I'll spend hours trying to clean you out.
